## Learning objectives {.unnumbered}

After reading this chapter, you should be able to:

- Understand the components of optimization problems: decision variables, objectives, constraints
- Apply optimization methods to climate policy and decision problems
- Recognize trade-offs between problem complexity and solution accuracy
- Connect optimization techniques to statistical inference and policy search

## Essential optimization concepts

1. Decision variables, objective functions, and constraints
1. Gradient-based optimization methods
1. Stochastic and sequential optimization
1. Policy optimization in climate risk management
1. Trade-offs between problem formulation and solution methods
